reviews.text: Great drama and comedy masterpiece. Acting of all the actors are best and screenplay also good

The movie reminded me of korean movie parasite especially the ending. But to its credit the storyline and characterisation is more realistic than parasite and the satire on human hypocrisy even with in its most closest bond the family is not lost on the audience, well past the close of the movie. Thoroughly enjoyed the watch and special mention on excellent performance of Siddharth Menon who lived 100% the character of fattu Shubham Gupchup. Thanks for this well=made movie...

Tired of sobby melodramas and stupid comedies? Why not watch a film with a difference? Chappad Faarke is both a drama and a comedy, which definitely absorbed the best features of the genres, creating a powerful and mind-boggling cocktail of love, hatred, sinful passion, rebellion, loneliness, fear and total liberation.

Watched this movie recently. Must say it gets interesting after the jackpot money bag is discovered. Its a satire on people who call themselves very honest and sanskaari just because they either never got into a situation where they were tested or they could weight how much benefit they were getting to be dishonest and so thought better to remain honest as not much gain was assessed. Their real values are tested when they get a very good opportunity to be dishonest and the benefits seem to be tremendous. Par kehte hai na lalach ka phal meetha nahi hota

There isn't a dull moment in the film! Director Hemant Joshi has accurately manoeuvred the plot to keep the viewer's interest alive. The characters have evolved organically with a plot, which enables them to play their part very naturally, befitting the situation. The comic timing is perfect. Overall, a fantastic movie, with an ending that is left open to the viewer's imagination. Perhaps the director plans on a sequel!

Chhappad Faadke... An off beat movie... Not made for mass....Vinay Pathak, he is too good...enacts life of an Ordinary common and honest man...a story of typical middle class family....a family abide by strong values and respect...well, you need to watch it to see their values and respect...each member of the family has its own priority which is hidden from others...how long that common values and respect sustains? ..what money can do to an ordinary honest man who has strong values and follows principals of honesty? The end is unpredictable...emotional but not for the family members of Mr Sharad Gupchup... 💰 is the most powerful tool in today's world above relations, respect, values and principals .. That's what they have shown...low budget movie.. Less known actors .. But worth seeing..It's on Hotstar... My ratings 6.5 on 10
A middle class family gets hit by lady luck and voila! The family is of upright moral but the miracle is too much for them to handle. The family is confused about it!
This movie comes from a very realistic zone. These adventurous experiences of a middle class family is way too relatable for a viewer.

Chhappad Phaad Ke dares to punch up to privilege & does fine job in doing it. This movie is a satirical tale of hypocrisy, politics, & consumerism rampant making often references to 2011 anti-corruption led by Anna Hazare & his disciple Arwind Kejriwal. Vinay in this movie plays an honest man while his wife & his children are often seen having hard time digesting the fact the their father won't compromise his integrity for stacks of money. Chhappad Phaad Ke will take you on a rollercoaster of emotions & will keep the audience hooked.

This movie showcases a perfect rendezvous of drama & comedy in itself. Shows how a low stardom cast can also entertain the audience and shows the true mirror for the middle class families of India and shows how greediness always leads to something bad at the end 😐

After half a century of monopolising the top spot, Citizen Kane was beginning to look smugly inviolable. Call it Schadenfreude, but let's rejoice that this now conventional and ritualised symbol of 'the greatest' has finally been taken down a peg. The accession of Vertigo is hardly in the nature of a coup d'état. Tying for 11th place in 1972, Hitchcock's masterpiece steadily inched up the poll over the next three decades, and by 2002 was clearly the heir apparent. Still, even ardent Wellesians should feel gratified at the modest revolution - if only for the proof that film canons (and the versions of history they legitimate) are not completely fossilised.There may be no larger significance in the bare fact that a couple of films made in California 17 years apart have traded numerical rankings on a whimsically impressionistic list. Yet the human urge to interpret chance phenomena will not be denied, and Vertigo is a crafty, duplicitous machine for spinning meaning...

What is it with 2020, we are getting finding cash stash movies back to back like Choked, lootcase and now Chhappad Phaad Ke. Is it just a coincidence or is it people's aspirations in search of easy money is churning out such movies. Each movie is different in its way thought with choked being technically apt, Lootcase for its wide array of characters and Chhappad Phaad Ke has the most believable screenplay among the three.The story starts around the Demonetisation era with an average middle class family with strong values stumbling upon a Cash stash by chance, and the changes that happens within the family as a result, forms the rest of the movie. Excellent Screenplay along with a sprinkling of humour as mentioned earlier is the main strength of Chhappad Phaad Ke. Very believable characters is another strong point in this movie that is casted decently. But very average cinematography and some poor makeup for the artistes spoils certain scenes. Music, especially the background score, filled with retro stuff is excellent. The director shows his class in the last 15-20 minutes of the film. Vinay Pathak playing the uncle next door character steals the show with yet another brilliant performance. Most of the supporting actors have done a decent job.Though Chhappad Phaad Ke's making looks like a soap opera on steroids, the story and screenplay definitely punches above its weight making it a better movie. If one hasn't watched either Lootcase or Chocked before it's definitely worth a watch. Overall it's a family movie and and makes an enjoyable watch.
